title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5908.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5908.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

For the purposes of this Part: (a) The term foundation means the New York

State Science and Technology Foundation, with headquarters at 99 Washington

Avenue, Albany, NY 12210. (b) The
term executive director means the executive director of the
foundation. (c) The term board means
the board of directors of the foundation. (d) The term applicant means any corporation
which is the subject of an application for financial assistance under the
technology and disabilities program. (e) The term disability means a disability as
defined by section
292
(21)
of the Executive Law. (f) The term T&D program means the
technology and disabilities program, a program of financial assistance and
technical assistance to developing and commercializing technologically
innovative products and services to aid individuals with disabilities, funded
by the State of New York, administered by the foundation. (g) The term technology and disabilities
program committee means the committee designated by the board to review and act
upon applications for T&D program financial assistance filed with the
foundation. (h) The term T&D
program manager means that member of the foundation staff designated by the
executive director to oversee the T&D program. (i) The term application means a company
business plan and such information and data related to the company as requested
by the T&D program manager. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5908.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
